Message.Title: Devil
Message.Msg: The greatest trick the devil ever did was convince people he was not real, as you can see his entire army works Wall Street.

Message.Title: Dell board
Message.Msg: The only thing good about this company is the board, dell is as good in its field as a couple of washers, or nuts would be to a sinker on a fishing line.

Message.Title: why are bond yields high
Message.Msg: before the takeover discussion, yields were in 2 percent range and then jumped to mid 4s...i dont understand why dell bonds are yielding so much? i'd appreciate a answer..thks

Message.Title: Personal Computer, Personal Car
Message.Msg: "PC is far from being obsolete, it's just technical mature and cyclical". Looking around, asking around. There are many ways of public transportation, but you still like your personal car, period.

Topic.Title: Icunt must be after assets and not really DELL computer company. that scavenger is nothing but a #$%$

Message.Msg: not much different than a board and management bleeding a company dry for their on best interest ,is it.

You have got to be kidding. There isn't much good at Dell or their assets other than then people. The board at this point should be considered inept at the very least and criminal for what they are trying to do here.

Topic.Title: End of the desktop, not likely, end of Micheal Dell as boss, more than likely.

Message.Msg: How on earth is he still in this business?? He is a cancer and the only think he has ever done was come up with a more efficient supply chain than anyone else in the beginning of home PC's. Now he wants to develop his own IP and be a technology leader. Keep in mind this is the same guy who spent $M developing a smart phone a couple years ago that was late, expensive and a complete failure against the competition in features and usability. He did this while the market was already saturated and the competition was far beyond them in product. Do you really trust this guy with you investments? Seriously?

Topic.Title: I found the secret to the markets. CHeck it out

Message.Msg: Because whomever takes over the company will load it up with more debt and that will cause the credit ratings of these bonds to be downgraded, hence the price adjustment.

If Icahn gets his deal, these LEAP options will reprice at $3 ($15-$12 dividend). The stub trades at $1.65 initially and may move up rapidly. But like your thinking. You'd only be giving away upside north of $3 on the stub.
